overview: From 2026-02-04 to 2026-02-05, elizaos-plugins/registry had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat: add @proofgate/eliza-plugin - transaction validation guardrails for AI agents
topPRs.author: bytes0xcr6
topPRs.body:
# Registry Update Checklist Registry: - [x] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name - [x] I've used github not github.com - [x] There is no .git extension - [x] It's placed it alphabetically in the list - [x] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: The plugin repo has: - [x] is publically accessible (not a private repo) - [x] uses main as it's default branch - [x] I have include elizaos-plugins in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to AI or crypto, please add those as topics as well. - [x] add simple description in github repo - [x] follows this convention - [x] an images/banner.jpg and images/logo.jpg - [x] package.json has a agentConfig --- ## Plugin: @proofgate/eliza-plugin **Description:** Blockchain transaction validation guardrails for AI agents. Validates transactions against security policies before execution to prevent prompt injection attacks, infinite approvals, and unauthorized transactions. **NPM:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/@proofgate/eliza-plugin **Repo:** https://github.com/ProofGate/proofgate-eliza-plugin **Docs:** https://proofgate.xyz/docs ## Telegram username [bytes0xCR6](https://t.me/bytes0xCR6) ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **Chores** * Added a new plugin dependency mapping to the project configuration. * Updated project dependencies and improved code formatting.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the `@proofgate/eliza-plugin` to the ElizaOS plugin registry, which provides blockchain transaction validation guardrails for AI agents to prevent security vulnerabilities like prompt injection attacks and unauthorized transactions. **Key Changes:** - Added `@proofgate/eliza-plugin` entry pointing to `github:ProofGate/proofgate-eliza-plugin` - Updated comma on previous last entry (`plugin-octav`) **Issues Found:** - The entry is placed at the end of the file (line 217) but should be alphabetically ordered around line 150, after `@elizaos/plugin-proof-of-agent` and before `@elizaos/plugin-pundiai-dataset` - The PR checklist claims alphabetical placement was verified, but this is incorrect **Required Action:** The entry must be moved to the correct alphabetical position to maintain registry consistency and comply with the stated checklist requirements.

Confidence Score: 3/5

- This PR has a significant ordering issue that violates the registry's alphabetical requirement - The change itself is simple and low-risk (adding a single registry entry with correct syntax), but the alphabetical placement is incorrect, which violates one of the core checklist requirements. The JSON syntax is valid and the comma handling is correct. The alphabetical ordering issue needs to be fixed before merge. - index.json requires the new entry to be moved to correct alphabetical position (around line 150)

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `@proofgate/eliza-plugin` entry but placed in incorrect alphabetical position |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant GH as GitHub Actions participant Script as generate-registry.js participant NPM as NPM Registry participant Repo as Plugin Repository Dev->>PR: Add @proofgate/eliza-plugin to index.json PR->>GH: Trigger on merge to main GH->>Script: Run npm run generate-registry Script->>Repo: Fetch package.json via GitHub API Script->>NPM: Fetch package metadata Script->>Script: Validate @elizaos/core compatibility Script->>Script: Check v0/v1 version support Script->>Script: Extract repo description, topics Script->>GH: Generate generated-registry.json GH->>PR: Auto-commit generated file ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
